Holiday Money Get in touch Book a video call Make an enquiry Call 0800 713 715 Help Get in touch Back View gallery / Back Best of Sarawak - Total Holiday Options Kuching - Total Holiday Options Borneo Flavors of Sarawak with Total Holiday Options 10 Nights • Transfers • Meals Overview Inclusions Terms & Conditions Flavors of Sarawak Embark on an unforgettable 11-day, 10-night journey showcasing the very best of Borneo’s nature, culture, and adventure. This tour ventures deep into remote, untouched regions, offering breathtaking sights and authentic encounters with the natural world. While a bit of comfort may be sacrificed, the reward is a rare opportunity to explore parts of Borneo few travellers ever experience. Accommodation is generally comfortable, though several nights are spent in rustic jungle lodges—some without air conditioning—immersing you fully in the environment. The itinerary is thoughtfully designed to be both compact and well-paced, suitable for travellers with average fitness levels. View more View less 10 nights + transfers & meals as specified from $ 3732 per person share twin. Flights are additional Enquire now Sale Period : until sold out Deal Includes: 10 nights accommodation Assistance and transfers by vehicles and boats Meals as specified (drinks are not included) English speaking local guides Sightseeing as specified Entrance fees One-way Economy Class airfare between Kuching - Mulu Bottled water while travelling All current applicable taxes except Malaysian Tourism Tax Malaysian Tourism Tax (RM10 per room per night at all accommodation) - payable directly to the hotels is additional International flights are additional Travel Dates & Pricing From $3732 per person share twin. Based on select departure date of 05 Mar 26 From $4105 per person share twin. Based on select departure dates of 02 Apr, 01 May, 04 Jun, 02 Jul, 06 Aug, 03 Sep, 01 Oct, 05 Nov & 01 Dec 26 Flights are additional Ask us about Solo Traveller Pricing! Itinerary Day 1: Arrive Kuching On arrival at Kuching International airport, meet your Tour Executive who will assist you and transfer to the hotel. Stay three nights in Kuching. Day 2: Semenggoh Wildlife & Sunset Cruise After an early breakfast proceed to the Semenggoh Wildlife Centre to view orphaned or rescued semi-wild orangutans in a natural setting. Later in the afternoon continue to board the MV Equatorial for a 1 hour Sunset River cruise on the Sarawak River which is a wonderful way of observing Kuching City. (B) Day 03: Excursion Bako National Park After an early breakfast, enjoy a short drive to Bako village and proceed by boat to the park headquarters and explore wildlife around the area. Enjoy lunch at the canteen and then continue to the National Park. This Park is one of the best places in Sarawak to see wildlife in a natural setting and home of Borneo's endemic probosci’s monkeys, silvered langurs, long-tailed macaques, wild boar, monitor lizards and numerous species of birds. The Park also has an impressive range of mangrove to kerangas (heath forest), tropical swamp vegetation, cliff vegetation and beach vegetation. (B, L) Day 04: Kuching - Nanga Sumpa Today after an early breakfast, drive to Batang Ai reservoir. Along the way stop for lunch and stroll around the shops at Lachau Bazaar. Board a local longboat and travel upriver to the Iban village. The afternoon is yours, free to explore and in the evening visit Nanga Sumpa longhouse. Relax on the ruai (common veranda) and spend time with the Iban people. Interact with the community, learn about their culture, and enjoy some local rice wine. Stay two nights at Nanga Sumpa lodge. (B, L, D) Day 05: Excursion to Enseluai Waterfall Today after breakfast, hike the jungle trails along the river for about an hour to another longhouse, then Board a local longboat and travel upriver to the Enseluai waterfall. Relax, swim and enjoy the rainforest surroundings and a riverside BBQ lunch. Later return to the lodge and spend rest of the day at your leisure. (B, L, D) Day 06: Nanga Sumpa - Lubok Kasai After breakfast head upriver to the Kasai Jungle Camp for an overnight stay. Enjoy lunch at the riverside before heading into the forest with the local guides to ‘forage for your dinner’. Wild ferns, ginger shoots, bamboo shoots, bamboo containers – all the items that will play a part in your evening meal. In the afternoon, trek to look for orangutan and in the evening enjoy a sundowner “Tuaktail” (local wine spritzers) in the middle of the Borneo Rainforest. (B, L, D) Day 07: Lubok Kasai - Kuching Enjoy a morning walk and after breakfast, pack up, load the boats and head downriver to the jetty and travel back to Kuching. The remainder of the day is for you to explore the old colonial city centre of Kuching or just be at your leisure. Stay two nights in Kuching. (B, L) Day 08: Rainforest Kayaking After an early breakfast, proceed to Bengoh, the starting point of your kayak adventure. Float down a river that meanders through spectacular limestone hills clad with tropical rainforest and punctuated with Class 1 to Class 2 rapids providing a thrilling water ride. Visit a friendly Bidayuh Village, have a swim in the cool refreshing mountain water and enjoy a light picnic lunch on the sandy riverbank. (B, L) Day 09: Kuching - Mulu National Park Deer & Lang Caves Transfer to Kuching airport to board a flight to Mulu National Park. On arrival, transfer to your accommodation. In the afternoon, enjoy a scenic 3 km plank walk through the primary rainforest to the entrance of the famous Deer Cave. Later, visit the Lang’s Cave famous for the stalactites and stalagmites followed by Bat Observatory known for a spectacular exodus of about 2 million bats leaving the cave in search of food. Return to the park accommodation and stay two nights in Mulu National Park. (B) Day 10: Clearwater & Wind Caves Today, proceed by longboat upriver to Wind Cave famous for its impressive ‘King’s Chamber’, stalactites and stalagmites. Then head to Clearwater Cave, a habitat for unique species of plants. Enjoy a picnic lunch, swim, or relax before returning. The rest of the afternoon is free for your leisure and in the evening meet for the farewell dinner. (B, L) Day 11: Mulu Departure After breakfast, the tour finishes with a transfer to the Mulu airport where you board a flight for your onward journey. (B) B= Breakfast, L= Lunch, D= Dinner Terms & Conditions Valid for new bookings only until sold out. Advertised prices are correct as 22 Oct 25 but may vary due to exchange fluctuations or for unforeseen circumstances until paid in full. • Prices are subject to change without notice until time of confirmation. Prices may vary due to a number of factors including tax and surcharge increases, exchange rate movements and availability. Malaysian Tourism Tax (RM10) per room per night is payable direct to all hotels.• All travel must be commenced and completed as specified • Some surcharges, closeouts, flight, routing & accommodation restrictions apply • Twin share is based on 2 adults sharing a room. Bedding configurations may vary. • Any credits or meals that are unused are not refundable, transferable & can’t be exchanged for cash. Where meals are included, this is food only, beverages are an extra cost. • Advertised prices are per person based on payment by cash or eftpos. Credit card fees will apply • Amendment and cancellation fees apply. • Domestic & International flights are additional and not included. • Accommodation ratings are based on House of Travel ratings and are a guide only to the overall quality of the property • Packages are subject to availability • Please ask your House of Travel consultant for full details.
